ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: It is a shame these songs don t exceed the haste cap. At the ripe old age of 53 I am finding that stat increasing songs don t help much -- with shammy buffs
ygData.messageBody:
It is a shame these songs don't exceed the haste cap.
At the ripe old age of 53 I am finding that stat
increasing songs don't help much -- with shammy buffs
and jewelry, the melee types in my guild are already
pretty much maxed out. Shammy slowdowns and enchanter
speedups further reduce bardic effectiveness in a well
attended raid.

Anybody tried soloing in Western Wastes?

--- "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)"
<garramone@...> wrote:
> Actually the Ervaj songs (50 and 60) do stack with
> all forms of haste,
> spell/song or item, so they can do it if they wanted
> to. They were
> advertised as also going over the haste cap, but
> tests have shown they
> do not. They are 5% and 10% respectively (useless
> that small and
> without going over the haste cap), probably designed
> that way with the
> intent of being 10% and 20% with instruments, which
> they require rather
> than just being able to sing with the lesser stats.
> However as we all
> know, unfortunately instruments do not increase
> haste (or mana) on any
> of our songs, just stats like strength, agility,
> etc.
>
> Shada
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
> Sent: Saturday, August 25, 2001 1:56 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> Not sure if they could do the stackable haste spells
> the way they
> currently
> work. They might be working on it dont know. But
> currently 1 haste
> spell/icon and one item is all that will stack (sure
> you knew that, just
> rambling).
>
> Mu
>
